quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Magic and Game
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, kamikaze, spells. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A wedge of what fruit is traditionally used as a garnish of the Cuba Libre cocktail?
Which of the following spells in the card game Magic: The Gatheringcan destroy both creatures and enchantments?
In the card game Magic: The Gathering, if your opponent casts Rend Flesh at your Hand of Honor, which spell could you use to save your creature?
Which of the following cards has a converted mana cost of 2 in the game Magic: The Gathering?
Which of the following is the most expensive card in the game Magic: The Gathering?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Lotus

questions.question: Which of the following colors is  not used in the card game Magic: The Gathering?
At what time of the year is the Tom and Jerry cocktail served traditionally in the United States?
What popular cocktail is made simply by mixing vodka and orange juice?
What kind of alcohol is used for the preparation of the Bacardi cocktail?
A player begins a game of Magic: The Gathering with 40 life points.
Which of the following is not a Magic: The Gathering game format?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One Eyed Cyclops

questions.question: This cocktail was reportedly the first drink the American astronauts had when they returned to Earth in 1969.
In what country did the Kamikaze cocktail reportedly originate?
Who created the collectible card game Magic: The Gathering?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Garfield

questions.question: Which of the following cards in the game Magic: the Gathering is from the Onslaught Block?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Visara, the Dreadful

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Plant and Country
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, margarita, ground. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This well known plant derives its scientific name from Atropos, one of the Fates in Greek mythology, who held the shears to cut the thread of human life. The plant grows shiny black berries that are sweet to the taste but very toxic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deadly Nightshade

questions.question: What popular herb is added to the Mojito cocktail for a refreshing flavor?
This plant can be used as a herbal medicine to treat gastric and intestinal problems, migraine, asthma, anemia, depression, anxiety and nervous ailments, among others.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Johns Wort

questions.question: This very unusual plant, seen quite frequently during the Yuletide season, is a parasite growing on the branches of trees and deriving its nourishment from them.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of the these

questions.question: Cultivated on a huge scale for the brewery industry, this plant grows separate as male and female.
Name this plant grown worldwide in parks, gardens, and greenhouses as an ornamental fixture with large colorful flowers also known as Wedding Bells and Heavenly Blue.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morning Glory

questions.question: The juice of what fruit is used for the preparation of the Cosmopolitan cocktail?
What kind of alcohol is used as a base to make the popular Manhattan cocktail?
What is often put on the glass rim when serving a Margarita cocktail?
This plant grows wild in the dry, desert ground of Texas and Mexico and is one of the very few spineless varieties among some two thousand different types of cacti growing in the world.
This perennial herb was once used to make absinthe.
This plant has a long and colorful history and its legal status varies from country to country.
In which country was coffee first roasted and brewed?
Name this small tree also known as the Apalachin, whose leaves are used to prepare a strong infusion that contains large amounts of caffeine.
This perennial herb from the mint family, that grows in wet soil, comes in two forms, a creeping variety and a more upright one.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Coffee and Lacoste
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, offers, ground. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Green coffee beans can be roasted at home in less than 30 minutes.
Lacoste offers clothing for kids, men and women.
After roasting, one pound (0.5 kg) of green coffee beans yields how much dried coffee?

options.text: Slightly more than one pound / 0.5 kg
Slightly less than one pound / 0.5 kg

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slightly less than one pound / 0.5 kg

questions.question: Green coffee beans can be roasted on the stovetop in a frying pan.
Who is the founder of the clothing brand Lacoste?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: René Lacoste

questions.question: Once ground, how long does it take before coffee begins to stale?
After harvesting, coffee beans must be dried.
Where is the clothing brand Lacoste originally from?
Island coffees are some of the smoothest and most expensive in the world. Where do they come from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the fruit of the coffee plant called?
Green coffee beans stay acceptably fresh for how long?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Several years

questions.question: The world’s most expensive coffee, Kopi Luwak, goes through a unique harvesting process. In Indonesian, “kopi” means coffee and “luwak” means what?
Does the clothing brand Lacoste offer ophthalmic glasses as well as sunglasses?
Do Lacoste have shoes as part of their collections?
Aspiration is one of the Lacoste perfumes for women.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Consumption and Type
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, birds, food. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of fish may be consumed according to Jewish dietary laws?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fish with fins and scales

questions.question: The consumption of what type of birds is forbidden by Jewish dietary laws?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Birds of prey

questions.question: In what way should an animal be slaughtered in order to be suitable for eating according to Jewish dietary laws?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What type of food should be at least partly prepared by Jews to be considered suitable for consumption according to Jewish laws?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: There are no stores of the clothing brand Lacoste in Canada.
The name of the clothing brand Lacoste literally means the cost in French.
There are Lacoste boutiques in Europe.
The consumption of what type of insects is allowed by Jewish dietary laws?
Rose hips, the fruit of the rose plant, are rich in what vitamin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin C

questions.question: The consumption of which of these mammals is forbidden by Jewish laws?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The consumption of what type of bread is forbidden on the holiday of Passover according to Jewish laws?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leavened bread

questions.question: What types of food should not be mixed, consumed or stored together according to Jewish dietary laws?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meat and dairy products

questions.question: What is the general term used for the food that is forbidden by the Jewish dietary laws?
What is the correct term for the sharp protuberances growing out of the stem of the rose plant?
What part of any animal is absolutely forbidden for consumption by Jewish laws?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Popeyes and Calories
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, chicken, popeyes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many calories does 1 piece of mild chicken breast, offered in Popeyes, have?
To what continent is the rose species commonly known as Gallic Rose native?
The red rose is a symbol of this political ideology.
Popeyes franchising began in 1976.
The Rose Valley is located near the town of Kazanlak, in what major world producer of rose oil?
Did Popeyes merge with KFC in 1989?
Popeyes opened their 1000th restaurant in New Orleans, LA.
What is the common name for the rose species Rosa Chinensis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China rose

questions.question: Who sang the Popeyes trademark jingle Love that Chicken?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. John

questions.question: Which of these countries has adopted the rose as its national flower?
What Belgian artist dedicated his life to painting roses and other flowers and plants?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pierre-Joseph Redoute

questions.question: How many calories does one biscuit from Popeyes have?
In what year was the first Popeyes restaurant opened?
What city in the state of Oregon is known as The City of Roses?
Who are the founders of Popeyes Chicken  Biscuits?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Copeland and Jerome Pentsky

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Peaches and Country
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, peach, chicken. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the usual color of the flowers of the peach tree?
This American state produces about 65% of the peaches grown for commercial production in the U.S.A.
Black Diamond, Black Pearl and Nightfall are cultivars from this fruit.
The Prunus genus, to which peaches belong, does not includes which one of these trees?
What American president was known for having an orchard garden with peach trees at his Moticello estate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about storing peaches?

options.text: Storing peaches for ripening is useless.
Peaches should be stored at room temperature.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Nectarines are often mistakenly thought to be a crossbreed between peaches and these fruits.
Which of these methods is the best for planting a peach tree?

options.text: Planting should be north-south when the trees are planted in rows.
Trees should be fully exposed to the sunlight and a free air flow.
The best time for planting peach trees is early winter.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The peach tree belongs to the Prunus genus which is indigenous to this country.
In what year did Popeyes go global?
How many prestigious industry awards did Popeyes Chicken  Biscuits win at their 30th anniversary?
What other name is commonly used for the wolfberry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Apart from China and the United States, which other country produces peaches on a large scale?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Peach trees bloom in beautiful aromatic flowers in this season.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Early spring

questions.question: The precise number of people killed at Hiroshima by the atomic bomb is not known due to destruction of records, etc.
